NEW LIVEJOURNAL!  New adaptations:

-Friends Only
--COmments Screened
---NO ANONYMOUS COMMENTS!
----More poetry!
-----More News pieces I find intresting!
------More discussion yet less messaging


ENJOY! Add me!

Or so it seems, as Private First Class Bryan M. Eberly, a journalims soon-to-be broadcasting student at the Defense Information School here, is starting anew in the communications world.  Not only does he have a new cell phone, but soon will have a new livejournal, and a new spin-off MySpace page.

Stay tuned to pvt_thoughts' livejournal pages to see the updates!

Cell Phone: 240-412-9026
The phone is this little cute blue thing that wieghs no more than a ciggarette lighter.  It has a professional look to it, but still an almost closeted bisexuality to it.  It works for me.

That's all for now, but come back soon for more!

OORAH!
Pfc. Eberly (Ebs, Bryo, Bryan, Starving Jew)

He's just a little taller than me...120 lbs roughly...blond hair...skinny as a stalk of corn...and he's from Georgia.

And I want to kiss him again...

what do you do when both play hard to get; and both are indeed hard to get?

don't answer.

grr...need to find a woman.

Mass., Penn., and Virginia (and probably more) are all commonwealths, not states. So, why is Puerto Rico not considered a state?  It's a commonwealth of the U.S., isn't it?

Hmm...do we have 51 or 47?

Kentucky too...so 46?

first thoughts I had this morning upon waking up.

I am hiding mnay things sergeant, and there is plenty running through my mind.  Unfortunately, I am at no liberty to discuss the issues I push down and drown deep, or else my hopes and dreams for my future will tumble down like cheerleaders with headcolds.  I sincerely wish I could just talk about what's bothering me, but I can't, and I am distracted.

There are so mnay conflicting thoughts and visions in my head, I am suprised I'm not tearing myself apart like a sinner in the 5th circle.  Is this right? Is that right? Should I or should I not? What does the UCMJ say? What does the Koran say? The Bible? My parents? My NCOs?

and, of course, where do I stand on these issues?

You are right to say that I need to rethink my values.  You are so right I ought to cite you for a ribbon. But how?  How do I rethink what I gave up thinking about?

Sleep would probably be a good start, so therefore, good night.

OORAH, semper Fi

Private First Class Bryan M. Eberly

HA!

So, how is everyone?  No one called...I have juice and nobody wants to squeeze my lemon-scented brain. Na ja, oh well.

New Orleans...maybe...

more randomness...and done.

dune.

no, done.

GOD i'm bored.

CIAO

So...I met someone.  Won't say too much, as the dangers surrounding the event...nah, I won't say nothing at all.  Call me if you really wanna know.

ciao.

OORAH!

(also, I hate the words "cooperation" and "profit"...they've become meaningless scapegoats.  and yes...no...perhaps.  

and dance)

miss you fluffy!

To start it off...I got my gray belt.  Sgt. Homa suprised us by teaching us all the rest of the moves...30 of them in 30 minutes...and giving us the test at Sunset.  It feels so awesome! I can now kick people's asses in 45 more ways! and defend myself in 14 more!  hehe.  Be worried my brothers, be worried. Just kidding, ya'll know I'll never hurt you.

The next morning, the detachment got up early and left for Gettysburg.  What an amzing little field trip. 

We ran the entire tour. Literally, we were either jogging, running or sprinting from site to site, stopping only for Master Chief to give us some information. It was so very Marine-like. I was so tired by the bonfire we had that night.  

The bonfire was so much fun. The entire detachment just sat around it and told stories.  Our NCO's had the greatest looks on their faces, and our CO was laughing her ass off after we told them. It's good to know they can get to know us without the pressures of...well, nevermind, it's a marine thing.

We camped out and I realized that a pop-tent can be a very comfortable thing.  Especially since I'll be using it alot if I go to Afghanistan.  Actually, I'm hoping for that deployment.

We came back and I spent Friday just hanging around, watching TV. I watched Baseketball, Hostel (YUCK! EW! GROSS! WHAT THE FUCK???), Batman Begins, and part of the exorcism of emily rose.  

And also...Team America..."EVERYONE HAS AIDS! AIDS AIDS AIDS AIDS!"...take that Rent! How dare thee get stuck in my head and cause me to sing your catchy songs in the middle of PT???

Saturday was pretty boring. I caught up on sleep and laundry. Two things abdly needed.  But Saturday night I went with Joe, Kari, Mario (dave), and his little Texan girlfriend to a Hookah bar in Baltimore. The Zeeba Lounge is a really nice place.  It's small, comfortable, has tasty foods and a belly dancer! And this woman was so gorgeous! I tucked 5$ into her little skirt. hmmm...anyway.

So now it's sunday and I'm getting my ahir cut and cleaning my room. The fun never ends at the Marine Detachment, Fort Meade.

Ciao bella, OORAH!

--Bryan (Private's Fucking Crazy)

The gray wolf runs through the burned timber
of a mountain which thrusted up through the Earth
Like my heel breaking the skin
Of that very terra.

My pride is like silvery mercury:
poisonous but not lethal in small doses.
Lethal is the edge of my hand
splitting the bone of the bulging laranx.

...and then my roomate walks in and I lose my train of thought within his pride of becoming the next a-gunner...grrr...

anyway, oorah! goonight!

Private First Class Bryan M. Eberly, USMC's creature-nemesis:

The Dreaded LORAX
'What creature will become your nemesis?' at QuizGalaxy.com
EVERYONE'S AGAINST ME! EVEN STORYBOOK CHARACTERS! come and get some Lorax, come and get some... OORAH

and I can do absolutely nothing to cure it damn it.

fucking priscilla's in heat and it rubs off on me...and stupid rules keep me from having illegal fun.

Illegal fun.
Do you not feel the blood run?
It pumps straight from heart to crotch
like a levvy broken from some

hard-torn...

anyway, i need some. 

Who the fuck likes me???  I'm not in high school anymore Marine...come forward damn it. 

Tonight's performance is brought to you by the prisoners of my vas defrans.

bitchs.

OORAH.

WOOO!!! It's friday! YES! I'm coming home! Don't know how much I can hang out though.  I want to spend sometime with mother. I know, I know, (why?). She did give birth to me, afterall. Plus, I was hanging with this soldier...I think she was a Sgt1stClass...and she just reminded m so much of mom. So now I miss her like crazy.

I will see everybody who is home. Myke, Jenn, Kate, Laura, and... swing by my crib to add yourself to the list.

I also want to cook. I just got a great new recipe I want to try. 

My roomate's a fucker. He's going to NY. We're still on restriction. Loser. He could have come home with me, but he takes his wedding ring off when he goes out. And he gets angry when it's mentioned he's married. Why? Loser.

Well, that's about all for this morning. Protein juice drinks are vile. I'm getting my graybelt very soon.  Sgt. said he'd like to give it to me right now, but I still have a few more training days left.

Okay, I gotta get my chuckies on.  Oh, by the way, I can't wear any civilian clothes this weekend, unless I'm inside my house.  These NCOs are tricky. Not only are they watching me, but so is the Air Force, Navy, Coast Guard and Army NCOs. FUN!  Oh well, it's a comfortable uniform.

Time to make the digital photographic newspapers.  I have to turn in my camera today :(. 

Jesus and I love you all very much!

This stuff mainly (oh, and blood, guts and death):
Get this video and more at MySpace.com incase that doesn't work: http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoid=552583904&n=2

Queens quit quickly,
Said  who threw the Chine
and it burst like the radiance of sunshine
setting on her little sea.

I then saw her in a trunk;
everything except her evening dresses
telling histories of happiness:
Her first babe before her first drink.

Yesterday she was on the corner,
begging for beggars with their meat
sloppily slapped into her hands.
She makes little waves.

Now she shakes in front of me,
Smiling the grin of greed and regret.
I cannot put the quarter in the cup.
She has no cup to offer.

Queens quit quietly,
Said she who through the glass
burst like icicles hitting frosted ground
decorating worse than tenage pride.

--Pfc. Bryan M. Eberly

hehehe...*sigh* so offensive...oh well

Motiavted again.  Thanks to Sgt. Homa and LCpl Fredericks.

OORAH!

100% ten percent.  Does't make sense?  Well, look at the Marine Detachment Fort Meade as an example.  The 10% of the marine corps who are shitbags reside and go to school here.  And here's why:

-Gossip & Rumors 24 hours a day
--Theft and Burglary even after restriction
---People contemplating breaking the restriction
----Easter Egg Hunt gone bad...not really funny because it's so embarrassing
-----Underage Drinking and coming back to the Det
------Leaving Marines behind
-------Over zealous NCOs
--------Refusal of Joint Service
---------Falling out of 30 min. group runs
----------So many out of shape Marines


and so on and so forth.

Very demotivated right now.  I'm gonna go eat greasy food and talk to the Navy. At least they're supposed to be shitbags...lol...j/k...OOrah seamen!

--bryan

Eddie Izzard...then Rocky Horror...then Tori Amos...then poptarts...then Pulp Fiction...then someone likes my poetry.


I'm in a decent mood. 

OORAH

That's all the complaining about my muscle pains for today.  God, it feels like bootcamp again.  Except, I have to buy my own aspirin. oh well, .99, no big whoop.

So, how is everyone?  I'm pretty good.  

Newest development in the MarDet Gone Wild incidents:

Liberty Uniform Regulation: Service "C" or Blue Dress "D"

yep...every single hour I am off base, i am wearing one of those uniforms.

Any anti-military bastards who say anything to me...just please don't.  Leave me alone, don't bring anything up to me. Okay? Good.  

lol, i say that as if the entire country is reading this journal. *sigh*

Have a great rest of the day! OORAH!

--Bryan

Yesterday evening was not good...not good at all.

But something good came out of it.

I've signed up for a gray belt martial arts class.  For all of you who got a letter from bootcamp, I will now be a graybelt marksman.

I decided that instead of having an NCO bark at me like I were a recruit, I was going to get some physical activity done.  It helped.  My anger faded away, and when one of the sergeants mentioned the belts effectiveness towards promotion, my motivation peaked right up.

I didn't even care that m room was torn apart by those overzealous NCOs inside.

I do care that my roomate thinks it's my fault.  He can fuck himself on that one. Mr. I-talk-back-to-fleet-returnees-because-they're-just-Lance Corporals.  They still have authority jackass, you don't downtalk or talk back to them.

Anyway, I'm in a decent mood right now.  My muscles are tight and burning, and I'm awake.  Today is also Photojournalism day. YIPPY!

God I hope things get better.

Corporal Bryan M. Eberly

Doesn't that sound nice?  Yeah....

fear that fucking name all you future Marines.  fear that name.

FUCKING GOD DAMN CHILDREN! YOU ARE ALL FUCKING HYPOCRITICAL MISTAKES! HOW THE HELL DID YOU SAY YOUR FIRST OORAH WITHOUT CONSIDERING WHAT YOU WERE GRADUATING TO DO? HUH??

GOD DAMN IT. 

I SHOULD FUCKING BELT EVERY LAST ONE OF YOU MOTHER FUCKERS! I SHOULD FEED YOU THE DETERGENT FROM YOUR FUCKING SCRUB TOWELS! 

OH YEAH.

i am so pissed right now I can't even right another curse word.

FUCK YOU DEVILDOGS!

(except pagan, payne, villagran, stewman and tomlinson.  ya'll were with me, ya'll are good)

How is everyone this fine Monday morning?  I'm doing well, thank you.

I just got back from New York, the Bronx.  It was awesome.  Many people might think of the Bronx as a "hood" full of spanish hoodlums and guns and drugs.  Well...what city isn't???  lol.  Seriously, the Bronx is a really nice area, and I now know 35 Puerto Ricans and 10 Dominicanas by first name, and they know me.  Family is real tight up there.  I enjoyed it.  Prisclla's family is indescribable.

I also went to Tribeca.  Saw a new monument they built: Irish Hunger Rememberance.  It was a very nice. Very touching.  Very tranquil.  It's built to look like a piece of the Irish countryside.  It's very pretty.  

I also saw Ground Zero.  nah...I don't even want to get started my feelings there.  

I got my haircut by a nice old Puerto Rican...took nearly an hour.  lol.  But once you go Puerdiqua (I forget the actual spelling), you can never go back.  So, I have to find a new barber nearby.  

I may or may not be coming home this weekend, but I do have the 29th scheduled to come home.  I won't back out on that.

PT was fun this morning.  I just love when my Marines give thier full 75%.  It really shows that they know why they joined.  

I may be changing ym name soon.  "Persona Fully Clean" or something, so look out for that.

That's about all I have to pass.  Oh, sleeves up today! WOO!  Get to look like big bad mother fuckers again. YES!

Anyone have anything for me? Very well, if no one has anything for me, I have nothing for you.

What?  Yes, features today. No rewrite, meaning I'll be locked inside the barracks until two A.M again.  I have to srive for perfection this time. My last story was weaker than a high school gothkid who lost his parents to a car crash because his dad was hitting the mom while driving because he just snorted three lines a crack he had to suck dick for in order to stay awake at night to make enough money for the rent of the typical suburban house with a two car garage and a cadillac that is being mortgagsed off to prevent it being forclosed because the dad lost all his ... anyway...

Any bitches, gripes, moans, complaints or suggestions?

Going once...
Going twice...
Sold...

Have a great day.

"You know how much of a whore you are?"
"Faggot."
"Good then, give some of your milkshake."

Fun times, fun times.

Going to the Bronx tonight.  I might suspiciously laid.  OOrah payday.  Oorah Photojournalism.  YES!

And I look so damn good in my blues.

Well, I didn't fail.  Quite the fucking opposite...I had the highest grade in the class.  Capt. Goodrich-Hinton says I have a type A personality.  I expect perfection, and when I feel even one flaw, I tend to give up all hope, and expect the worst.  

"But more often than not, the dishes still get cleaned," she said.  (that's in reference to her metaphor with dirty dishes and she forgets to clean one cup before she drains the sink.)

CO rocks. 

So I'm going to the Bronx this weekend.  That fucking rocks. For most of the day before the party, however, I'll be patrolling the avenues of Manhattan.  Strawberry Fields forever bitches!  I wonder if I can take my camera...?

Getting sick of my roomate coming in the middle of the night and bitching about nothing.  Look, you little shitbag, if you get drunk, show up to the detachment past curfew and then leave your daggon key somewhere, it's your fucking fault.  Stop taking it out on the fucking NCO who yells at you, and stop mumbling about it.

SITFU, mother fuckers, SITFU.  Oorah.

I miss my puppy. *sigh*  Such a good dog.  What is she gonna do when Angus goes away?

Well, on that depressing note, I should go.

"We can act like we're old friends,
Going over it all again--
Talking about everything I am doing wrong."
--Kathleen Edwards

"Why do men think so fast? Because we have two heads.  
Why do women talk so much? Because they have four lips."
--Sgt. William Pearsell, Jr.

In other news...

What the fuck devils?  Why so many rumors, and why won't they stop; knowing that 1st Sgt. has said things to us about five million times so far?  And why is another couple getting married?  The madness just won't end!

I cannot wait to be an NCO.  It's gonna take some work...but I'll be Sergeant Bryan M. Ebery by March of 2008.  God, I can see it now:

"What the fuck devil?  Since when do we fucking marry our sister?" and other quips.

School should be fun today...I'll find out if I've failed or not.  I'm kinda excited about that.  I wish it was phtotjournalism day again...I have such good days then. Just point, click, and blind your partners. FUN!

Watched Eddie Izzard last night with a barracks mate.  That was good times.  It was the extremely British version, so I had to translate.

"What's a queue?"
"It's a line."
"Oh, what's a tram?"
"It's a moving cart."
"Oh. What's brown bread?"
"It's...wait, what?" *smack*

lol...actually, I should have told him "pumpernickel." oh well, smacking him for being retarded's more fun.

Tempted to join NSA or CIA when I get out.  I'll look into it.

Well, I gotta go. Lance Cpl.'s are screaming for room inspections.  I love you all.

Have a blessed Marine Corps day! (meaning, get dirty, sweaty, and act like a jackass to at least one person)

--Bryan

The tired, demotivated Private lies in his rack and gazes at his watch.

"It's gonna take a fire to get me out of this rack," he says to his roomate and laughs.

He falls back asleep.  As he begins to dream of a heavy make-out session with some hotty with nice big...

The fire alarm screams throughout the barracks.

"THIS IS NOT A DRILL!" A sergeant screams in competition with the alarm.

The private jumps out of his rack, thanks God his boots are still on and rushes outside.  

There's full accountability and no one is hurt.  The fire was small, and accidentally caused.

Karma's a bitch.

List Ten Things You Want to Say to Someone But Know You Never Will:

1. Mind your own fucking business...Sergeant.

2. Don't assume you know the situation from just five minutes of it.

3. Preception is fucking reality...fucking rabbits.

4. How many more of you are gonna get married?

5. STOP BEING IN SUCH A GOOD MOOD!

6. Nice job corrupting your authority

7. I have names First Sergeant

8. I miss you.

9. I'm in love with...

10. 85%? YOU FUCKING STIFLING DOUCHEBAG!   (this actually becomes: 85? Thank You Sergeant.)

That's fun.  Actually, four of those things I'm gonna go say now.

See ya'll!

so, I might be failing, and I didn't make broadcasting.

No matter though, because I am ultra-photogenic and I can tryout again in April. OORAH.

yeah...so...there :)

He's still there.  He's still grabbing at the strings of my heart everytime I have a few moments when I am allowed to think.  He still makes me cry before I fall asleep at night.  I miss him.  I feel horrible for letting him go so easily.  He was ready to change his life for me...he was ready to truly love me.

Why do we make these choices so young?  Why must we believe we know what's right?  

I want him back.
I'll never get over him, will I?  No man, or woman will ever be better than he was.  But does that mean I should give up looking?  Feels right...I don't know.

Mindless self-delusion.  I need comfort of types.

--eberly

Both hands (in my pants) - ani difranco
Time is running out (in my pants) - Muse
This apparatus must be unearthed (in my pants) -- Mars Volta
Like humans do (in my pants) -- David Byrne
Gasolina (en mios pantalones) --  Barrio Fino


i thought those were the funniest on my list.

If the Marine has taught me nothing it has taught me one thing:

Despite how stupid you feel...you're probably doing shit right.

Doing things right isn't easy...it even hurts sometimes. 

On that note...


I'm very camera friendly
And I can right a damn good localization article.

Bitches.  OORAH!

GOOOOOOD...you wanna say "fuck the EGA?" gooood...get on your face right now...get up right now...get on your face right now...down, up, down, up...side-straddle hops right now...one, two, three...we're clappin' on top, we're clappin' on the bottom...run in place right now...moutain climbers...switch, switch, switch, switch...left, right, left, right...change step...left left right...push, push push!...down, up, down up...get up right now...First general order?...nope...push...down, up, down, up...First general order?...goooood...we don't wanna sound off...get to my pit right now...moutain climb...left, right, switch, switch, switch...run to that corner right now...10, 9, 8, 3, 2,...oh we didn't make it...get to that corner...10, 9, 3, 2...gooooood....get on your face...eat the sand...use that mouth for something if you don't want to sound off...okay, now spit it out right now...now push, push, push...down, up, down, up...get up right now...dismissed...oh, you don't wanna say "ay, sir?"...gooood...i got more coming for you...get outta my pit!

*pant*, did I really type fuck the EGA? Gosh damn!  *pant, pant, pant*

lol, i could use a good IT session for real

"You might as well toss off your cover boy,
And rip the glory from your heart.
I have seen so many better,
and to look you in the face:
There is something wrong in God's plan.

I wonder if Jesus were caught without power,
Would they have done worse than cruicfy?
I'm sure a rock he face,
Would hurt him less deeply
Than not saying "hello" for years."

I'm going to send her flowers.  Fuck me for being so damn worthless.  

and fuck the EGA is I am such a damn bastard

And why won't thespacebar work correctly?

This week has been fun, but I can't waitforliberty to start. 3 hours fromnow,hopefully. damn spacerbar.

sleep and read and sleep and read and salute the flag!

WOO!

call me! anybody!!!

240-682-5407

maybe I'll call you...duhn duhn duhn!

I guess I've made a home in the Corps, as my father would say.  I came home from an awesome vacation with my brothers, and realized...these Devildogs here really are my brothers and sisters.  I miss Eek, BroBro and J-cat, but I have a comfortable towel here warming me on a vent.

Also...I have flag detail, so I won't be able to come home this weekend :(...I'll try next week definitely.

Kate, still have the same number?  Still at papas?  When do you work, etc.?  We need a photography expedition to Marshall Hall with subway sandwiches and what have you.

British guy stationed here with me.  He says "butternuts" funnily.  hehe.

Okay, OORAH!

Why is it that I like a girl, get close to her, and then befriend her???


Why can't I be a immoral pig like the rest of them???

GRR!  I hate gay-leaning bisexuality!

Why would you condemn them to marriage
And sacrifice yourself?
Without a head, eyes, 
Mouth or tongue...

How will you sanctify such a blessing?

I will be hard at work;
will continue to flush out
Any further thoughts of a past life.
It's over now, isn't it?

Put me in a prison and I'd write a book.

I'd rather write their vows.
I'd rather kiss her on the mouth
and him on his cheek.
I would condemn myself to solitude...

With fullest honesty I would choose love.

--Brahin Abrli 20060213


(RIP Javaun David Ricardo Dixon.  I miss you.  We all miss you.)

Just keep it in step;
Left...Right...Left
Clap it on the left foot...

I was born then,
along with 176,000
Days go by without consolation

Have I done anything?
176,000 times NOPE!
But we love to doubletime...

I do this all the time.

--Brahin Abrli 20060207

I really really miss them.

I miss a lot of people.

But I really really miss them.


Yes...I smoke...so do you...get over it...i love you.

*sigh*

I am not blaming you.
Coincedentally I am a rock,
splattered by water.
Why can't I move,
or stop when I tumble?

Yesterday was a good day for me.
Couldn't I have left it with that?
You had to become proud of me,
Didn't you?  You're the slut.

--Brahin Abrli 20060205

PROMOTION!!!

Private Eberly has moved up the ladder.

He is now to be known as:

Private First Class Bryan Michael Eberly.

OOrah!

1.  Don't Fuck female Marines
2.  Female Marines will kill you.
3.  I'd rather do the NAVY chick I saw at the messhall the other day...hmmm...curly redhair...

SO!  I'm done wth MCT, as you may or may not have noticed.  Actually, I guarantee you haven't noticed.  I haven't updated.  It wasn't too bad.  Of course, what the fuck is worse than 17 straight days in the field??? I was so fucking dirty!!!  But, I learned alot, andmy confidence towards battle is high.  Send me in coach, I'm ready to tear the throats out of some Hahjis!  or some mukes...i'd like to kill some mukes (genocidal Sudanese)

Currently, I am at Ft. Meade...an hour away from home, awaiting my pick in Combat Correspondency school.  This base is pretty cool.  It's actually surprisingly relaxed.  I can use my phone, I can smoke, I can eat whenever.  AWESOME!  Plus, I'm next to the Air Force, Army and Navy.  So I'm constantly reminded of how good I am.

Not to be cocky...fuck it, I've worked hard.  OORAH!

So, I'm still pondering over whether or not to come home this weekend.  Any thoughts?  Kate?  I miss you.

Well, Semper Fi, I will see you all eventually.

Call me Kenny!  I have TICK TICK BOOM stuck in my head again!

Well, back to training; that is to say if I do train.  If there is a God, I'll finiswh this and be able to make the next move.  Ft. Meade.  *sigh*. The place where I both want and regret to be.  Hard to explain. No, easy to explain.  I want to be near home, but I don't want to be near home.  Um...I'd rather have gotten Quantico, or Belvoir.  You know? Somewhere close to home, but still feeling exoctic.  At least, as exoctic as military bases can be.

I'm glad I saw nicole again.

I had a decent x-mas.

I love you all!  If I update within the next two weeks...hell will break lose.

Semper Fi

Pvt. Eberly (Bryan)

You Are Scary
You even scare scary people sometimes!
How Scary Are You?
You Are 32 Years Old
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?
You're An Alcoholic
Time to go back to step one.
What Kind of Drunk Are You?

Well, I am certainly drunk...and therefore I am sharing my pride of the USMC.  We were born in a bar...hence, I"M DRUNK!!!  (whenever I'm not working)

Just thought I'd share.  I love you all.  I almost typed: "al"...hey, al, call me.  I need to be assured that not all ARMY guys are assholes.

Funny stories.  Call me to find out.

OORAH! Semper Fi, Ecce Homo.

PVT. EBERLY.

Hey everyone!  Still not in training, but still quite busy.  I'm on a working party that demolishes old furniture.  I tear the wood from the metal, burn the fabrics, and throw the wood out in the dump.  Just the other day Sgt., LCpl., and I were trying to hit seagulls.  Now normally, and especially if you've heard my story of the dead seagull, I would be against such cruelty.  However...THERE WERE SO MANY OF THEM!!!

I thinned out their numbers.

The thing I'm truly against is when stupid, restless, bored Jarhead-grunts toss rocks at the birds, and laugh as the poor thing lies paralyzed on the deck.  Who was laughing when the grunt had to crush the bird's head?  Well, I wasn't, but I felt satisfied that the situation was punished accordingly.  Stupid, stupid jarheads.  

We're not all killers.  No, not true, I am a killer.  We don't all kill superfluously or for pleasure.  That is wrong.  A man takes another man's life when that life is deemed central to threats, terror or general human waste.  Understand?  Good...this is the official Marine Corps status on physical violence.

But we are all trained to kill.  I could do it very easily using my fingertips.  *thrusts forward* "MARINE CORPS!".  hehe...such a fun little movement.  just thrusts forward with the fingers extended...so simple, so deadly.

Okay, enough about death.  What's new?  I just bought the two new Shakira Cd's.  Spanish good, english annoying.  I also bought the two latest Coheed & Cambria CDs.  Both are very good.  I'm listening to "In Keeping Secrets of Earth" or some shit like that.  It's their third CD.

Well...I can't stand still...so I'll update again later.  Ciao Bella.  Semper Fi.

--Pvt. Eberly

(...But never Will...)
